snippet.title: Jagged Alliance: Deadly Games (PC DOS) - Longplay (Part 1 of 7)
snippet.description:
Longplay of Jagged Alliance: Deadly Games, a tactical role-playing game released in 1995 by Sir-Tech for the DOS systems.

A sequel to "Jagged Alliance" (Although considered by some to be more of a spin-off game), you receive missions from the legendary mercenary, Gus Tarballs himself.

In order to accomplish these missions, you'll have to contact A.I.M and hire the right personel for the job. Get it right and you get paid, screw up and Gus gets mad as hell, Woody!

This longplay covers the tutorial campaign, rather short but it's difficulty rises up rather quickly for novice players, which offers a good challenge for those who aren't familiar with the Jagged Alliance series.

First tutorial mission, pretty much self-explanatory and ridiculously easy to do it, even with turns mode turned on. My first choices for campaign mode are usually Grunty and Fox.

Grunty learns rather fast and he's not a bad marksman (But don't count on it too much), his pyshical stats are also pretty good in comparison to say, most of JA:DG rooster... Also, he starts with a Colt .45 pistol, which is better than the S&W .38 revolver.

Fox is probably the best choice for field medic, she's pretty fast and shoots better than the numbers suggest (Again, don't count on it too much), like Grunty she also learns rather fast too.
